notes.left: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.

description.left: The code to represent the cancer type of a prior malignancy using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.
description.right: ICD-10 diagnostic code for type of cancer in a prior malignancy.

description.left: If donor has history of prior malignancy, indicate laterality of previous diagnosis. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE: 4122391)
description.right: If donor has history of prior malignancy, indicate laterality of previous diagnosis.

primary_site.name: primary_site
primary_site.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

codeList: Bones, joints and articular cartilage of limbs
Bones, joints and articular cartilage of other and unspecified sites
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues
Other and ill-defined sites in lip, oral cavity and pharynx
Other and ill-defined sites within respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
Other and unspecified female genital organs
Other and unspecified major salivary glands
Other and unspecified male genital organs
Other and unspecified parts of biliary tract
Other and unspecified parts of mouth
Other and unspecified parts of tongue
Other endocrine glands and related structures
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system
Spinal cord, cranial nerves, and other parts of central nervous system

description.left: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.
description.right: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

notes.left: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

description.left: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
description.right: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Please refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

description.left: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
description.right: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

left: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen
right: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

left: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

deleted: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

central_pathology_confirmed.name: central_pathology_confirmed
central_pathology_confirmed.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen aquisition was related to.

reference_pathology_confirmed.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
reference_pathology_confirmed.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist. This only applies to clinical studies.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

description.left: The code to represent the cancer type using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.
description.right: The code to represent the cancer type using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2016/en#/) classification.

notes.left: This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

stage_suffix.name: stage_suffix
stage_suffix.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.description: Unique identifier of the primary diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider.

notes.left: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
notes.right: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treament details may be required to be submitted.

left: Combined chemotherapy, radiation therapy and surgery

deleted: Combined chemotherapy, radiation therapy and surgery

description.left: The interval between the primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.
description.right: The interval between primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

notes.left: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

description.left: The duration of treatment regimen, in days.
description.right: The duration of treatment regimen, in days

submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this treatment was related to.

line_of_treatment.name: line_of_treatment
line_of_treatment.description: Indicate the line of treatment if it is not the primary treatment.

days_per_cycle.name: days_per_cycle
days_per_cycle.description: Indicate the number of days in a treatment cycle.

number_of_cycles.name: number_of_cycles
number_of_cycles.description: Indicate the number of treatment cycles.

outcome_of_therapy.name: outcome_of_therapy
outcome_of_therapy.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

toxicity_type.name: toxicity_type
toxicity_type.description: If the treatment was terminated early due to acute toxicity, indicate whether it was due to hemotological toxicity or non-hemotological toxicity.

hemotological_toxicity.name: hemotological_toxicity
hemotological_toxicity.description: Indicate the hemotological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

adverse_events.name: adverse_events
adverse_events.description: Report any treatment related adverse events. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

codeList: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify
Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify
Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify
General disorders and administration site conditions - Other, specify
Injury, poisoning and procedural complications - Other, specify
Joint range of motion decreased cervical spine
Joint range of motion decreased lumbar spine
Metabolism and nutrition disorders - Other, specify
Musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorder - Other, specify
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps) - Other, specify
Pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal conditions - Other, specify
Renal and urinary disorders - Other, specify
Reproductive system and breast disorders - Other, specify
Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify
Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other, specify
Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify

clinical_trials_database.name: clinical_trials_database
clinical_trials_database.description: If the donor is a participant in a clinical trial, indicate the clinical trial database where the clinical trial is registered.

clinical_trial_number.name: clinical_trial_number
clinical_trial_number.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.

chemotherapy_drug_name.name: chemotherapy_drug_name
chemotherapy_drug_name.description: Name of agent or drug administered to patient as part of the chemotherapy treatment regimen.

meta.notes: This field uses a controlled vocabulary gathered from the DrugBank database of drug names.

drug_rxnormcui.name: drug_rxnormcui
drug_rxnormcui.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin

drug_name.name: drug_name
drug_name.description: Name of agent or drug administered to patient as part of the treatment regimen.

This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin

application_form.name: application_form
application_form.description: Indicate type of radiation therapy administered.

radiation_treatment_type.name: radiation_treatment_type
radiation_treatment_type.description: Indicate type of radiation therapy administered.

description.left: Interval from the primary diagnosis date to the follow-up date, in days.
description.right: Interval from the primary diagnosis date to the follow up date, in days.

notes.left: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
notes.right: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

description.left: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
description.right: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.

notes.right: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

description.right: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
